name: Turquoise Shell Inn

reviews.text: First let me start by saying that everything wonderful everyone has said about the TShell Inn is all true. Marcus and Carter are wonderful! I had the pleasure of interacting with them prior to our arrival and their attention and recommendations were on point (and we hadn't even arrived). One thing everyone should know so you don't make the same mistake I did, when you book your stay, book it thru their website and not thru Expedia or any other 3rd party website otherwise you'll end up paying an additional 18% tax which is already included in the rate which is quoted on the TShell's website.
reviews.title: Loved Our Stay at the Turquoise Shell Inn
Truly Enjoyed Our Stay
reviews.text: Unfortunately we didn't leave on Friday when we were supposed to due to a snowstorm and Carter was wonderful in accomodating us to check in the next day and extend our stay by one day (so we left on Wednesday instead of Tuesday). He even confirmed that our trip to St. Barths was moved from Saturday to Tuesday.

When we finally arrived to this wonderful island, Carter greeted us with a smile, showed us to our room and gave us some advice on where to eat and what to do. The room is quaint, with a nice little kitchenette which was nice because we went to the grocery store and bought a couple of snacks to hold us over while we were there. There's a TV with cable if you need to see what's going on in the states but just know it's not the cable you are used to so if you are expecting every channel under the sun, you'll be disappointed (but then again, who goes to Paradise to watch TV). The Inn is situated away from the main road so you don't hear the hustle and bustle of the road but yet you are close enough to it to walk around and get something to eat or stop and see the bridge open up when the yachts are going in and out of the harbor. During the day, starting around 10ish until about 8ish you will hear airplanes flying overhead but that really didn't bother me being from the city, I'm used to it. And no matter where you are on the island (at least on the Dutch side) you will hear the airplanes so folks who complain about that should probably stay on the French side. The small swimming pool is nice after a long day of siteseeing to sit back and relax.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, clean rooms, kitchen, close to everything
likes.disliked: — noise (but every place we stayed at in the Caribbean had it's own noise problem)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prior to our arrival, Marcus had arranged an island tour for us with Michelen which was wonderful. After the island tour she dropped us off at the Sunset Beach Bar where we sat and watched the airplanes come in (definitely worth seeing).
reviews.title: Personable Quaint Inn

reviews.text: All in all, the trip was wonderful (after we finally arrived) and my mom truly enjoyed her 70th birthday. (Had dinner at the Gondola, another recommendation from Carter, definitely would recommend) From the wonderful emails and recommendations from Carter and Marcus, to the wonderful beaches and restaurants (and boy, are there restaurants!). The Inn is located 10 minutes from the airport so if you are like me and don't want to rent a car, the taxi is only $8 which is great. The one thing we didn't do which hopefully on my next trip I'll do, is really spend some time on the French side. If you decide that you want to travel around the island then definitely rent a car but if not, taxis are good and so is the little bus. Definitely take advantage of the day trips to St. Barths, Saba and/or Anguilla. We went to St. Barths and had a lovely time.
reviews.title: Wonderful Inn
Hide away at Simpson Bay
reviews.text: We stayed at the Tshell inn just after the Heineken Regatta. The rooms were clean and had everything we needed including a good size kitchen. The Tshell Inn is located right in the middle of Simpson bay so for us it was easy to walk to all our favorite restaurants and bars. We would get up early for breakfast at Ric's place then go and watch the Big Yachts come in and out of the bridge. We would have to say Tshell inn is above average, compared to the places we have stayed in SXM. We highly recommend it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted a moderately priced hotel for one night upon our arrival in St. Maarten as we planned to go to Saba early the next day. The Turquoise Shell Inn exceeded all of our expectations. The owners (I presume) Carter and Marcus were wonderful to us and made us feel so at home! The property is quaint, clean, and an excellent location on Simpson Bay. If you walk out the back of the hotel, you are steps from a nice beach with a wonderful view of Saba and some very cool mega yachts in the bay. The hotel sits far enough off the main street in front to be very quiet, but walk out on the street and it is very "happening" and lots of fun. The marina area directly across from The Turquoise Shell was fantastic, with some cool bars to hang out amidst more mega yachts, not to mention plenty of good restaurants. The rooms at the Turquise Shell were one bedroom apartments, and we were able to go to the market and bring back breakfast for the morning. The beds, AC, water pressure, TV channel selection were all great, not to mention the internet access worked wonderfully and the pool was really nice too! As planned, we went on to Saba and had a great time, then had planned to stay in the Marigot (St. Martin) area for a couple days before heading to Anguilla. We checked into a hotel in Marigot and I felt overwhelming disappointment. I did not like this area at all! (Though I did like Orient Beach and Grand Case on the French side)) We longed to get back to The Turquoise Shell. We got the heck out of that place in Marigot , and headed back to the Turquoise Shell Inn hoping for a vacancy. Technically, there was no vacancy as housekeeping is off on Sundays, but Carter said he would have a room for us later in the day and he prepared it himself.. That was amazing service and we appreciated it so much! We toured the entire island and got back later in the day feeling so lucky that we were back at the Turquise Shell. We enjoyed watching the boats/yachts come in at the drawbridge around 5:00 which is just minutes from the hotel. We, like so many others on Tripadvisor, loved Maho and watching the planes land and take off. It was really exciting and the entire Maho area was so much fun! The Turquise Shell is just a short drive to that area of the island. All in all, the whole St. Maarten/St. Martin/Saba/Anguilla trip was fantastic. I will definately stay at The Turquise Shell Inn again, and would recommend it to anyone!
reviews.title: Loved this place!

likes.liked: — The friendly staff, the location, and the value!

reviews.text: My wife and I were looking for a low to moderately priced place in a good location. We didn't expect a fancy resort, but this place exceeded our expectations. The location is superb. It's just literally a few steps from beautiful private Simpson Bay beach. It's only a very short walk to everything you need, including good restaurants, and only a short drive from the airport and good shopping. Our room was very clean, and was larger than we expected, with a full kitchenette. Most of all, the owner was very friendly and attentive to our needs, much like you would get at a very high priced B & B. Don't expect beatifully clean properties surrounding the inn...there apparently are very few zoning laws, as there are some trashy spots close by. But the inn property itself is well kept and charming. And just across the street from the inn is a beautiful marina housing multi-million dollar yachts. We would love staying here again.
reviews.title: Great value!
Found a Gem
reviews.text: The Turquoise Shell Inn is a sweet 12 unit Inn with pool, positioned between the Bay and the Lagoon at Simpson Bay. We had a 2 room unit with a complete kitchen. The best thing about the Inn is the charming staff who took care of our every need. This isn't a fancy upscale site, the plumbing has it's problems and there is no central air but the fans worked well and our room was clean and well appointed. If we get back to that area, I would definately stay their again.

The Turquoise Shell is a cozy inn with superb service. We stayed for a long weekend over New Years and were very happy with the accommodations. We were traveling on a budget, and found the location perfect for walking to a number of excellent restaurants (El Rancho especially) or getting taxi or bus rides to shop in Phillipsburg and explore the French side. The hotel offers day access to the tranquil Simpson Bay beach. The staff was very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.text: The Turquoise Shell is definitely recommended for long weekends or week-long stays. The kitchenette is fully equipped, the rooms are very clean, and it's a great place to rest and rejuvenate after all the fun of this island.
reviews.title: Big Bang For Little Bucks!

reviews.text: Wow! What an excellent hotel! It in a prefect location with about 17 restaurants in walking distance along with a bunch of other shops (including a 7-Alive, like a 7-11).
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Staff and Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms have a kitchen/living room area and bed room. Tons of space! The beach is about a 100 foot walk and the airport is about a $10 taxi ride and takes about 13 minutes (if not less).
reviews.title: Worderful Stay!

reviews.text: I will stay here again over the other mega resorts in a heart beat. I really enjoyed the personal touch offered.
reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed
Room given to someone else.
reviews.text: Left the Turquoise Shell Inn yesterday, after our 3rd stay. The hotel was very well kept, as it was in our previous stays. The rooms are spacious, and always immaculately clean. Hosts were very friendly and helpful, and the mile long Simpson Bay Beach beach behind the Inn is just beautiful. You can't go wrong staying at the Turquoise Shell Inn!
